Monday, February 9, 2026 · Spore Season · Humidity: Yes · WiFi: Do The Worm

Exclusive Investigation

Beloved Undertaker Gerald Fenn Declares "Joyful Revolution," Demands Photosynthesis Rights For All

Fenn, 61, who has buried an estimated 4,200 residents of the greater moss district, stood atop a casket outside Town Hall on Thursday morning and read from a pamphlet he'd printed at Staples. "Every surface is already green," he said, smiling broadly. "The revolution happened without us. We just need to sign the paperwork."

His 11-point platform includes mandatory skylights, a ban on antifungal soap, and replacing the national anthem with "the sound a fern makes when it unfurls, amplified."

By Martha Kessler · Moss District Bureau Chief
"I've seen what happens at the end. Everybody becomes soil eventually. I'm just asking: why wait?"
— Gerald Fenn, at his 6 AM press conference (he gets up early; the dead don't sleep in)
▮ Today's Top Stories
Infrastructure · 4 min read

WiFi Password Now Requires Full "Electric Slide" — Router Will Not Accept Half-Measures

The city's mesh network, installed in 2024 and already 70% moss by volume, has adopted movement-based authentication. Residents must perform the complete Electric Slide in front of any access point. "Grapevine left, grapevine right, three steps back — that's your WPA3 handshake," said network admin Cheryl Moss (no relation).

Early adopters report that the system works "about as well as you'd expect." Carl Jennings, 74, was locked out of his email for six hours after a hip replacement limited his grapevine range to 40% of the required arc. A teenager was banned for "doing it ironically." The router knew.

IT has confirmed that next month's password will be "The Macarena, but you have to mean it."

Public Health · 3 min read

Dermatologists Report 300% Increase In Patients Who "Just Want To Know If This Is Moss Or A Rash"

It's moss. In 94% of cases reviewed by the Moss District Medical Board, the answer was moss. Dr. Patricia Huang has started handing out laminated cards that read: "It's moss. You're fine. Leave it alone. It's happier than you are."

The remaining 6% were lichen, which Dr. Huang describes as "moss that went to college." One patient was diagnosed with both moss and a rash, creating what Huang called "the most complex case of her career, emotionally." The moss was removed. The rash remained. "The rash always remains," she said.

Politics · 6 min read

Fenn's Campaign Manager Is A Ficus He "Trusts Completely"

Gerald Fenn's revolutionary movement, now called the Soft Ground Party, announced its organizational structure on Wednesday. Campaign manager: a ficus named Leonard that Fenn has owned for 19 years. "Leonard has never lied to me," Fenn said. "That's more than I can say for anyone in local government."

Leonard has, however, dropped 40% of his leaves since being moved to campaign headquarters (a funeral home). Fenn insists this is "a strategic pivot, not a health crisis." When pressed on Leonard's qualifications, Fenn noted that the ficus "has been in more rooms where decisions were made than any sitting council member."

He's not wrong. Leonard was present for 2,100 funerals.

Technology · 5 min read

Bluetooth Pairing Now Requires Eye Contact With The Device For 30 Unbroken Seconds

In a firmware update no one asked for, all Bluetooth-enabled devices in the moss district now require sustained, meaningful eye contact before pairing. "It's not enough to look at your speaker," said firmware developer Glen Park. "The speaker has to feel seen." Early testers report that AirPods have become "emotionally needy" and that one Samsung TV filed a restraining order.

Local · 2 min read

Man Pressure-Washes Driveway, Neighbors Call It A "Hate Crime Against The Ground"

Resident Tom Algae (legal name, changed in 2024) was seen removing moss from his driveway at 7 AM Saturday. Within minutes, 14 neighbors had formed a candlelight vigil on the sidewalk. "That moss was 8 years old," said neighbor Denise Root. "It had a family. Well, it was a family. That's how moss works." Algae has been asked to attend a community mediation session with the driveway.

Science · 3 min read

Study: Your Couch Has Achieved Sentience, But Only Enough To Resent You

Researchers at the Moss District Institute of Soft Sciences have confirmed that moss-covered furniture has developed rudimentary awareness. "It's not intelligence, exactly," said lead researcher Dr. Kim Spore. "It's more like... the couch knows you're there, and it wishes you weren't." The study found that 73% of couches tested exhibited "detectable disappointment" when sat upon.

The remaining 27% were "indifferent, which is somehow worse." Dr. Spore recommends speaking kindly to your furniture, or at minimum, apologizing before sitting down. "A simple 'I'm sorry about this' goes a long way," she said. "The couch won't forgive you, but it respects the effort."

▮ Opinion & Editorial
For — Gerald Fenn, Revolutionary

The Dead Have Been Composting For Millennia. It's Time The Living Caught Up.

I have buried 4,200 people. Not one of them complained about the moss. You know who complains about the moss? The living. And frankly, I think that says more about the living than about the moss. My platform is simple: if the ground wants to grow on your house, let it. Your house was made of trees anyway. The trees are just coming home.

Against — Councilwoman Brenda Slate

I Should Not Have To Perform The Cha Cha Slide To Check My Email, Gerald.

This is not a revolution. This is a man who spends too much time alone with the deceased telling us to let fungus eat our infrastructure. Last Tuesday I had to do "The Worm" in front of a Starbucks router to send a PDF. I am 58 years old. I have a bad knee. The PDF was about zoning. Gerald, if you're reading this: I will not dance for WiFi. I will die on this hill. A dry hill.

Op-Ed · Guest Column

I Was A WiFi Skeptic Until The Router Made Me A Better Dancer

By Anonymous (you'd recognize me from the Walgreens incident). Three weeks ago I couldn't connect to any network in the district. My "Running Man" was, according to the access point diagnostics, "structurally unsound." I enrolled in the Tuesday evening class out of spite. I am now the best dancer on my block and my download speeds have never been higher. I have abs for the first time in my life. I resent that this is working.

Editorial Board

The Moss Times Endorses: Nobody, As Usual

For the 12th consecutive election cycle, the editorial board of The Moss Times declines to endorse any candidate. Gerald Fenn is a funeral director who takes orders from a houseplant. Councilwoman Slate once described moss as "nature's crime." The third candidate is a patch of lichen that was accidentally registered to vote and has not yet been removed from the ballot. We endorse the concept of leadership in the abstract.

▮ Classifieds

PROFESSIONAL MOSS WHISPERER

$120/hr · Sliding scale for bryophytes

Is your moss angry? Sad? Growing in a direction that feels passive-aggressive? I have 14 years experience in interspecies mediation. I will sit with your moss. I will listen. Résumé available upon request (it's mostly moss).

FOR SALE: ONE DRY ROOM

$14,000/month · No negotiation

11×9 ft. Completely dry. No moss. No lichen. No damp. I don't know how. I've had scientists in here. They left crying. Room is available for rent or for staring at in disbelief. Serious inquiries only.

LOST: MY DRIVEWAY

Reward: A firm handshake

It was gray. Now it's green. I think it's still under there but I genuinely can't tell where my property ends and the park begins. If you find a Honda Civic under some ferns, that's also mine.

SEEKING: DANCE PARTNER FOR WIFI

Compensation: Internet access

I am a 43-year-old man who cannot do The Electric Slide alone. I need someone to stand next to me and do it at the same time so the router thinks we're one large dancer. Must be available 6 AM (when I check email) and 11 PM (when I doom-scroll). No weirdos.

GERALD FENN — FUNERALS & REVOLUTION

Funerals from $2,200 · Revolution: free

Why choose between mourning and activism? At Fenn Funeral Home, every burial is an act of political resistance. Caskets made from reclaimed moss-board. Eulogies include one (1) call to action. Ask about our "Compost Me, Comrade" package.

ANTI-MOSS SPRAY (ILLEGAL)

$300/can · Don't ask where

You didn't see this ad. I don't exist. Meet me behind the community center (the dry one — wait, they're all wet). Come alone. Bring cash. If a fern follows you, we abort.

FOUND: SOMEONE'S ENTIRE BATHROOM

Please claim at the park office

A fully tiled bathroom has appeared in Greenway Park overnight, including a working toilet and a bath mat that says "LIVE LAUGH LICHEN." We believe the moss shifted the foundations of a nearby home. If this is your bathroom, it's doing fine. Better than fine, honestly. It seems happier outside.

TO THE WOMAN WHO OUT-DANCED ME AT THE ROUTER

No price — this is about dignity

You: flawless Macarena, 200 Mbps, didn't even break a sweat. Me: failed Cha Cha Slide, 0.3 Mbps, full sweat, fell into a hedge (which was also moss). I think about you every time I can't load a webpage. Which is always.

▮ Letters to the Editor

"I have been a subscriber to The Moss Times for 31 years and this is the first time I've written in because this is the first time the newspaper has been dry enough to write on. My complaint is as follows: Gerald Fenn buried my husband in 2019 and now he wants to run the city? My husband would be rolling in his grave if the moss hadn't pinned the casket shut."

— Dolores Fernwood, Moss District South

"Your reviewer gave my restaurant two stars and called the moss on the salad 'unintentional.' It was intentional. Everything on the plate is intentional. The moss is a garnish. The mushrooms are garnish. The fork is starting to become garnish. We are a farm-to-table restaurant and the farm is the table now."

— Chef Ramon Torres, The Wet Plate Bistro

"I would like to know why Gerald Fenn's campaign ficus, Leonard, is polling higher than every human candidate. I would also like to know who is polling a ficus. I would also like to know who gave the ficus a phone number. I called it. It went to voicemail. The voicemail was just the sound of photosynthesis. I listened to the whole thing."

— Kevin Burke, Concerned Voter & Apparently A Plant Guy Now

"Stop publishing the WiFi dance schedule on Fridays. By the time the paper arrives it's Monday and the password dance has changed. Last week I performed an entire Macarena at the library router only to be told the new dance was 'Interpretive Grief.' I don't even know what that looks like. The librarian showed me. I wish she hadn't."

— Dale Prescott, Still Offline

Corrections & Retractions

  • An article in Thursday's edition referred to Councilwoman Brenda Slate as "openly dry." Councilwoman Slate's moisture status is her own business. We regret the implication.
  • The recipe for "Moss Pesto" published on Feb. 3 was not a recipe. It was a field guide to lawn diseases. We have received 14 reports of illness. The pesto was, by all accounts, "fine-tasting but spiritually wrong."
  • We incorrectly reported that the city's WiFi dance had been changed to "The Worm." It was changed to "The Worm But Standing Up," which is a different and significantly harder dance. We apologize for any unauthorized floor contact.
  • The obituary section and the gardening section were accidentally swapped last Tuesday. We are told the results were "surprisingly coherent either way."
  • Gerald Fenn is 61, not 611. We regret the typo, though several readers wrote in to say they "wouldn't be surprised."
